caption.p: Seasonal variation in warming-induced rainfall increase (top), present-day and future snowfall fractions (middle), and surface warming (bottom), for two locations: one on the North Pole (90°N; red/orange) and one in the North Atlantic (75°N, 0°W; blue/light blue). Both locations are indicated in Fig. 3 (top panel) as yellow dots. PD refers to present-day (2006–2015 mean) while FU refers to future (2091–2100 mean).
